article_title: Men With Criminal Records Face Steep Challenge Getting Work
article_text:
CHICAGO—Two years after his release from a prison boot camp, Brian Thomas, a former drug dealer, finally landed a full-time job.

Mr. Thomas, 28 years old, started work last week washing pans and cleaning equipment for an airline food company at O'Hare International Airport.

With his record, Mr. Thomas had to knock on a lot of doors. His...

twitter.description: The more than 12 million men with felony convictions who are out of prison face steep challenges getting a job since employers are less willing to hire anyone with a criminal record.
twitter.creator: @mrmmpeters

article_summary:
Mr. Thomas, 28 years old, started work last week washing pans and cleaning equipment for an airline food company at O'Hare International Airport.
CHICAGO—Two years after his release from a prison boot camp, Brian Thomas, a former drug dealer, finally landed a full-time job.
With his record, Mr. Thomas had to knock on a lot of doors.
